title.rendered: Rooms for Rent in Echo Park

content.rendered:
So, you want to move to LA and are wondering which neighborhood would be best suited for you? Well, look no further because we might have the perfect neighborhood for you: Echo Park. A historically, culturally and architecturally significant neighborhood, finding rooms for rent in Echo Park is a dream-come-true for many. After all, it’s a neighborhood that has housed many brilliant actors, writers, activists and artists over the years. The average rent in Echo Park may be a bit on the higher side, but don’t worry – Roomi will help you look for cheap rooms for rent in Echo Park.

So, with all that in mind, let’s get to know the neighborhood a little better!

Getting to know Echo Park

If you’re a film buff (and you have to be if you’re living in LA), you’re going to love this one. Echo Park is significant to the early Hollywood silent films. Then known as Edendale (now split into Echo Park, Los Feliz and Silver Lake), was where the first silent film studios were set up. In fact, Charlie Chaplin used to live in Echo Park!

Since then, Echo Park has been the backdrop of the counterculture movement in LA and a hub for scholars, writers and artists from the world around. Today, the trendiest cafes, bars, shops are all here. And with the quintessential LA Mediterranean climate along with a beautiful Lake, Echo Park is one of the best neighborhoods in LA to live in. So, now that you’ve made up your mind about living here, let’s see how we can find cheap rooms for rent in Echo Park!

Finding rooms for rent in Echo Park

Find A Room For Rent In Echo Park

There’s no other way to say it- living in LA is expensive and the average rent in Echo Park is higher than the city’s average. Of course, you may still find cheap rooms for rent in Echo Park, but it’s still good to know what you’re getting into! So with that out of the way, let’s look at what the neighborhood has to offer.

Top neighborhoods in Echo Park

  • Elysian Heights: A district with a fascinating history counter-culture, this area is great for anyone who dreams of finding rooms for rent in a historically and architecturally significant area of Echo Park. Of course, that comes at a price. It’s hard to find cheap rooms for rent in this part of Echo Park. But the extra price is so worth it!
  • Angelo Heights- If you’ve ever fantasized about living in the Victorian era, this neighborhood might be perfect for you. Angelo Heights is lined with gorgeous Victorian houses that will take your breath away. Not just that, you also get a stunning view of the downtown LA skyline.
  • Victor Heights- Sometimes also called the Forgotten Edge, this neighborhood is great for people who want to live in a relatively quaint neighborhood. The district comprises a mix of apartments, condos, and old bungalows making it a great place for everyone, whether you’re a bachelor or a family of three. Plus, finding cheap rooms for rent in this district of Echo Park shouldn’t be too hard. Yay!

Related: Pet-Friendly Decor for Your Los Angeles Apartment

Average rent in Echo Park

University life in Echo Park

Echo Park is one of the best neighborhoods to live in for university students. Not only is the vibrant atmosphere great for the students, the rich history and architecture only enhances their college experience.

Yes, the average rent in Echo Park might be a little steep for a student budget. But if you can find roommates, then finding cheap rooms for rent in Echo Park should not be hard at all. And think about all the fun you’ll have! I mean, the Sunset Boulevard is right there – what more could you ask for as a student? Plus, there’s some wonderful vocational and community colleges in/near Echo Park itself that can provide you with a fantastic education!

The Top 5 Colleges in Echo Park:

  • Los Angeles City College
  • Angeles College
  • Los Angeles Pacific College
  • Galaxy Medical College
  • Stanbridge University

Related: Roomi Picks: Must Read Books About Los Angeles

How transit-friendly is Echo Park?

1. Walkability

Echo Park is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in LA. Most areas in Echo Park have a walk score of 84 on an average. That means, you don’t really need a car for most of your day-to-day errands. However, you should remember that other parts of LA are not known for being particularly walker-friendly, and most people do need a car to survive in LA. Remember to factor that in when you’re making a choice.

2. Roads/traffic

It’s no secret that traffic in LA is pretty bad. In fact, it’s one of the most congested cities to drive in. Echo Park is near the 101, the 2, and the 5 freeways. So, while driving in Echo Park itself is quite a pleasant experience, it’s still part of LA. So, be prepared for spending some time stuck in traffic on the regular.

3. Taxis

If you want to avail taxi services in Echo Park, LA City Cab has got you covered. Whether you want to go to the airport or just for a night out, LA City Cab is a reliable and reasonably priced option. Of course, Uber and Lyft are always just a click away!

4. Public transportation

If you’re worried about traveling in and out of Echo Park, there’s no need! The Neighborhood is quite public-transport friendly. Whether you want to travel by bus, train, or subway, Echo Park is extremely accessible! Here’s a helpful guide when traveling to Echo Park:

  • Bus: look for route number 10/48, 2, 4, 92.
  • DASH Train: take the San Bernardino Line
  • Subway: take B Line (Red)

Check this out for more information!

5. Airports

There are several airports in and around the Los Angeles Area. Here is the distance of each one from Echo Park.

6. Cycling

There’s some wonderful bike trails in and around Echo Park. Because Echo Park has many rolling hills, most of these trails are uphill or downhill. Because of this, Echo Park is one of the best places to be for biking enthusiasts. For a detailed list of bike trails and maps, check this out!

Nightlife in Echo Park

If you want to experience the quintessential LA nightlife, Echo Park is the place to be. After all, the world famous Sunset Boulevard is here. That should be convincing enough for anyone. So, when you find yourself in Echo Park, all dressed up for a night out on the town, be sure to hit these places up. You’ll make memories for a lifetime!

  • Bar Bandini
  • The Semi-Tropic
  • El Prado
  • Mohawk Bend
  • Bar Flores
  • The Short Stop

Shopping centers in Echo Park

Echo Park has some of the best shops in Los Angeles. Anyone who disagrees with this is clearly wrong – sorry! There’s an eclectic mix of bohemian style shops, upscale boutiques and everything in-between. Seriously, whatever your taste is, there’s something for you in Echo Park. With that said, here are our top picks for shopping in Echo Park. You cannot miss these!

  • Tavin Boutique
  • Myrtle
  • Lux de Ville
  • Spacedust
  • Echo Park Time Travel Mart
  • Otherwild Goods & Services

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Echo Park? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
